head.title: Neodesha USD 461 - Frequently Asked Questions about COVID-19

meta.content: Neodesha USD 461 - Frequently Asked Questions about COVID-19

Frequently Asked Questions
Regarding COVID-19
General Audience Questions
Why has the school district closed? The Governor has ordered that all schools close for the remainder of the 2019-20 academic year. This action is being taken to reduce the spread of the virus. Because the District’s top priority is the health and safety of our...

div.div: Your session will expire in 0 minutes.

p.style: border:none; margin-bottom:.0001pt; text-align:center; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: Frequently Asked Questions

p.style: border:none; margin-bottom:.0001pt; text-align:center; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: Regarding COVID-19

p.style: margin:0in 0in 8pt
border:none; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: General Audience Questions
Why has the school district closed?

The Governor has ordered that all schools close for the remainder of the 2019-20 academic year. This action is being taken to reduce the spread of the virus. Because the District’s top priority is the health and safety of our students and staff, we will continue to follow the guidance of federal, state, and local authorities throughout this situation.
What events are impacted by this closure?
All district activities and events for the 2019-20 academic year have been postponed until further notice.
Will graduation events be impacted by the temporary closing of schools?
At this time, no decision has been made regarding graduation. If a decision is forthcoming, we will provide this information through our website and Facebook.
Are teachers allowed to meet with small groups of students in schools?
No small group meetings are occurring between students and staff in our schools now or in the foreseeable future at this time.
What precautions are being taken to make sure our schools are safe?

Deep cleaning and disinfecting of surfaces and door handles in classrooms, office areas, and restrooms started the week of Spring Break and has continued non-stop through the closure of schools. The disinfectant being used is guaranteed to kill or mitigate the COVID-19 virus
I have additional questions. Who should I contact?
You may contact your building principal or the Superintendent of Schools, Mrs. Juanita Erickson, at 620-325-2610.

p.style: border:none; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: Questions for Parents
Can students and families visit the schools when they are closed?

All schools and facilities are closed to the public in order to support the order of Governor Kelly. A limited number of essential staff will be reporting to work to prepare our buildings for them to reopen.
Can parents pick up medicines administered from the school at this time?
If a student needs access to medicines administered at the school, please contact the school directly to make any arrangements.
How can my student(s) participate in breakfast and lunch services?
Information regarding food services is available on Facebook. Per federal regulations, each child must be present in order to receive a meal.
How can my student(s) access the internet at home to support Continuous Learning?
At this time we are working on some plans, however, they are not live yet. More details will come out at the end of the week.

p.style: border:none; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: Questions for Staff
Should a staff member or a student be quarantined?

If you have traveled to an area in which the virus has spread or otherwise believe you may have been exposed to the virus, you should seek the advice of a medical professional. All people who have traveled outside of the area should contact their supervisor.
Will staff get paid while the schools are closed?
All active, non-temporary staff will continue to be paid during this period.
Will faculty be provided planning time to prepare for online instruction?
The District’s plan closely aligns with the state’s plan with a full week of planning and preparation the week of March 23-March 27, 2020.

p.style: border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: Questions for Student

p.style: border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: Per Governor Kelly, Neodesha Schools is implementing a Continuous Learning Plan. Below is a list of Frequently Asked Questions from students:

p.style: border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: Teaching & Learning:

p.style: border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: When does instruction resume in Neodesha Schools?

p.style: border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: Instruction will resume virtually or by learning packets on Monday, March 30, 2020.

p.style: border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: What will day-to-day virtual instruction look like?

p.style: border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: Teachers will use different forms of technology, such as Google Classroom and Zoom, to deliver instruction and interact with students. Virtual chats may be recorded and posted on Google Classroom. Screen time will be shortened, and teachers will follow a common schedule.

p.style: border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: Are there expectations for students?

p.style: border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: Yes, guidelines will be posted concerning expectations for online learning.

p.style: border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: How will students complete elective classes?

p.style: border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: Elective teachers will continue to deliver instruction and work with students virtually or by packets.

p.style: border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: What will happen to Dual Credit Enrollment courses?

p.style: border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: Dual credit classes may resume as early as March 23, 2020. Students are expected to continue the work online like they would if they were in college.

p.style: border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: When will 3rd quarter grades be finalized?

p.style: border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: Teachers are picking up materials at school so that they can finish finalizing third quarter grades. All teachers should have third quarter grades finalized soon. Report cards and 9-week grade updates will be mailed to parents.

p.style: border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: What if students would prefer to drop a course rather than complete it virtually?

p.style: border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: All secondary courses will continue with online programming. If students do not complete a course, they will not receive credit for this course. Students can reach out to their administrators or counselors with questions.

p.style: border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: How will the material be graded? How will it affect semester grades?

p.style: border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: Elementary students Pre K-grade 6 will receive a pass/fail grade for the last nine weeks of school. Middle School and High School students will continue to receive a letter grade.

p.style: border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: What happens to missing assignments that were not turned in before spring break?

p.style: border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: We are committed to ensuring all students are successful. As such, teachers will be flexible in these situations. Please contact the teacher, if needed, to discuss further.

p.style: border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: How can we combat cheating or plagiarism?

p.style: border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: There are a variety of online tools to combat academic dishonesty that teachers can utilize.

p.style: border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: How will younger kids complete school online?

p.style: border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: We will be issuing devices to 2nd – 6th grade students and also sending packets home for them to work on.

p.style: border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: Health & Safety:

p.style: border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: How can students get help if needed?

p.style: border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: Students should reach out to their teachers for help. Each school’s mental health team (counselor, principal, social worker, teachers) will also be providing support for students.

p.style: border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: What if students left medicine at school?

p.style: border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: Parents are being contacted so that they can pick up the medicine.

p.style: border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt
border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: Upcoming Events:

p.style: border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: What is the status of prom?

p.style: border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: No extracurricular activities are allowed right now.

p.style: border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: What is the status of graduation?

p.style: border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: Graduation is postponed at this time. We will continue to follow health department guidelines and make a determination closer to the scheduled graduation date. As a contingency plan, we are working with students and families to create ideas for alternative programming to celebrate our graduates.

p.style: border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: How will 7th Grade orientation day be handled?

p.style: border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt

span.span: We will be working to develop alternative programming ideas to ensure 7th Graders have a smooth transition to middle school.

p.style: border:none; margin-top:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:.5in; margin:0in 0in 8pt

div.em: Current conditions as of 22 Apr 06:52 am CDT

div.span: Showers and thunderstorms, mainly after 11am. Some of the storms could produce heavy rainfall. High near 65. Southeast wind 7 to 15 mph becoming east northeast in the afternoon. Winds could gust as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%.

Showers and thunderstorms likely, mainly before 1am. Some of the storms could produce heavy rain. Cloudy, with a low around 52. Northwest wind 10 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%.
Mostly cloudy, then gradually becoming sunny, with a high near 75. Northwest wind 6 to 9 mph.
